intro: Alkibias mucronata, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, typically blooming in spring. Alkibias mucronata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry regions. It is also noted for its milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the Apocynaceae family.
